description: Wudu is the Islamic procedure for cleansing certain parts of the body using water before acts of worship like Salah. It is a condition for the validity of the prayer and a sign of both physical and spiritual purification.

importance.text: O you who believe! When you rise to [perform] prayer, wash your faces and your forearms to the elbows and wipe over your heads and [wash] your feet to the ankles.

steps_of_wudu: Wash both hands up to the wrists three times.
Rinse the nose by inhaling water and blowing it out three times.
Wash both arms up to the elbows three times, starting with the right.
Wipe the ears using the same wet hands.
Wash both feet up to the ankles three times, starting with the right.
conditions_for_validity: Use of clean and pure water
Washing each part without significant interruption
things_that_break_wudu: Touching private parts with the hand without barrier (according to some scholars)

hadiths.text: No one makes Wudu and does it well, then prays two Rakâ€™ahs without being distracted, except that Paradise is guaranteed for him.
When a Muslim or a believer washes his face in Wudu, every sin which he committed with his eyes will be washed away with the last drop of water...

benefits: Acts of Wudu are rewarded spiritually
recommended_etiquettes: Do Wudu before every prayer even if not required (if still in state of Wudu)
Face Qiblah while performing Wudu (optional but recommended)
Perform Wudu in a clean place
